page.title: 04Halling Church
page.content:
The Church of St.John the Baptist in Halling stands near the River Medway. It dates from the Norman period but the tower and chancel are more likely twelfth century.Wall paintings of this period can be seen over the Chancel Arch.
An unusual brass plate commemorates Sylvestre Lambarde's death in 1587.It was placed there by her husband William Lambarde,author of "Perambulation in Kent."
Much repair and restoration of the Church was carried out in the nineteenth century,when the clock was added to the tower and the Lychgate was built.Alterations and repairs are still being carried out in the 1980's
